title: Stock Futures Fall, Oil Again Tops $100 Amid Sanctions
sub_head: Russian ruble jumps after massive decline
body:
U.S. stock futures and global shares slipped, following days of whipsaw moves prompted by Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine.
Oil prices rallied, rising back above $100 a barrel. Brent crude, the international oil benchmark, rose 3% to $100.84 a barrel. Members of the International Energy Agency could agree as early as Tuesday to release supplies from oil reserves in an effort to keep a lid on rising crude prices.
